00040 #ifndef _physeventmanager_cpp
00041 #define _physeventmanager_cpp
00042 ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00043 //This will capture all event and store them for easy dispatching.
00044 //
00045 //There will be an instance of this class in the physworld.
00046 ///////////////////////////////////////
00047 
00048 #include "physeventmanager.h"
00049 #include "SDL.h"
00050 
00051 int PhysSDLFilter( const RawEvent *event );
00052 
00053 bool PhysEventManager::IgnoreSDLQuitEvents;
00054 
00055 /// @todo TODO: Make the PhysEventManager completely thread safe. IF this is completely thread safe, we can spawn numerous individual thread each accessing this and
00056 /// and the performance gain would almost scale directly with cpu core count increases. Look at boost scoped_lock
00057 
00058 PhysEventManager::PhysEventManager()
00059 {
00060     SetIgnoreQuitEvents(false);
00061     SDL_SetEventFilter( PhysSDLFilter );
00062 }
00063 
00064 ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00065 //These functions will give you the next event or help you manage the events
00066 ///////////////////////////////////////
00067 unsigned int PhysEventManager::GetRemainingEventCount()
00068 {
00069     return EventQueue.size();
00070 }
00071 
00072 PhysEvent* PhysEventManager::GetNextEvent()
00073 {
00074     if(EventQueue.size()==0)
00075     {
00076             return 0;
00077     }
00078     PhysEvent* results = EventQueue.front();
00079     return results;
00080 }
00081 
00082 PhysEvent* PhysEventManager::PopNextEvent()
00083 {
00084     if(EventQueue.size()==0)
00085     {
00086             return 0;
00087     }
00088     PhysEvent* results = EventQueue.front();
00089     EventQueue.pop_front();
00090     return results;
00091 }
00092 
00093 void PhysEventManager::RemoveNextEvent()
00094 {
00095     EventQueue.pop_front();
00096 }
00097 
00098 void PhysEventManager::AddEvent(PhysEvent* EventToAdd)
00099 {
00100     EventQueue.push_back(EventToAdd);
00101 }
00102 
00103 
00104 ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00105 // Filtered management functions - RenderTime Events
00106 ///////////////////////////////////////
00107 PhysEventRenderTime* PhysEventManager::GetNextRenderTimeEvent()
00108 {
00109     PhysEventRenderTime* results = 0;
00110     for(list<PhysEvent*>::iterator Iter = EventQueue.begin(); Iter!=EventQueue.end(); Iter++)
00111     {
00112         if((*Iter)->getEventType()==PhysEvent::RenderTime)
00113         {
00114             results = dynamic_cast<PhysEventRenderTime*> (*Iter);
00115             return results;
00116         }
00117     }
00118     return results;
00119 }
00120 
00121 PhysEventRenderTime* PhysEventManager::PopNextRenderTimeEvent()
00122 {
00123     PhysEventRenderTime* results = 0;
00124     for(list<PhysEvent*>::iterator Iter = EventQueue.begin(); Iter!=EventQueue.end(); Iter++)
00125     {
00126         if((*Iter)->getEventType()==PhysEvent::RenderTime)
00127         {
00128             results = dynamic_cast<PhysEventRenderTime*> (*Iter);
00129             EventQueue.erase(Iter);
00130             return results;
00131         }
00132     }
00133     return results;
00134 }
00135 
00136 void PhysEventManager::RemoveNextRenderTimeEvent()
00137 {
00138     for(list<PhysEvent*>::iterator Iter = EventQueue.begin(); Iter!=EventQueue.end(); Iter++)
00139     {
00140         if((*Iter)->getEventType()==PhysEvent::RenderTime)
00141         {
00142             EventQueue.erase(Iter);
00143         }
00144     }
00145 }
00146 
00147 ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00148 // Filtered management functions - User Input Events
00149 ///////////////////////////////////////
00150 
00151 PhysEventUserInput* PhysEventManager::GetNextUserInputEvent()
00152 {
00153     PhysEventUserInput* results = 0;
00154     for(list<PhysEvent*>::iterator Iter = EventQueue.begin(); Iter!=EventQueue.end(); Iter++)
00155     {
00156         if((*Iter)->getEventType()==PhysEvent::UserInput)
00157         {
00158             results = dynamic_cast<PhysEventUserInput*> (*Iter);
00159             return results;
00160         }
00161     }
00162     return results;
00163 }
00164 
00165 PhysEventUserInput* PhysEventManager::PopNextUserInputEvent()
00166 {
00167     PhysEventUserInput* results = 0;
00168     for(list<PhysEvent*>::iterator Iter = EventQueue.begin(); Iter!=EventQueue.end(); Iter++)
00169     {
00170         if((*Iter)->getEventType()==PhysEvent::UserInput)
00171         {
00172             results = dynamic_cast<PhysEventUserInput*> (*Iter);
00173             EventQueue.erase(Iter);
00174             return results;
00175         }
00176     }
00177     return results;
00178 }
00179 
00180 void PhysEventManager::RemoveNextUserInputEvent()
00181 {
00182     for(list<PhysEvent*>::iterator Iter = EventQueue.begin(); Iter!=EventQueue.end(); Iter++)
00183     {
00184         if((*Iter)->getEventType()==PhysEvent::UserInput)
00185         {
00186             EventQueue.erase(Iter);
00187         }
00188     }
00189 }

00191 ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00192 // Other functions
00193 ///////////////////////////////////////
00194 
00195 bool PhysEventManager::DoQuitMessagesExist()
00196 {
00197         return false;//This is system dependent. since we are using SDL, There is no real quit message
00198 }
00199 
00200 bool PhysEventManager::IgnoreQuitEvents()
00201 {
00202     return IgnoreSDLQuitEvents;
00203 }
00204 
00205 void PhysEventManager::SetIgnoreQuitEvents(bool Ignore)
00206 {
00207     IgnoreSDLQuitEvents=Ignore;
00208 }
00209 
00210 int PhysSDLFilter( const RawEvent *event )
00211 {
00212      if ( !PhysEventManager::IgnoreQuitEvents() && event->type == SDL_QUIT)
00213         { return 0; }
00214      return 1;
00215 }
00216 
00217 #endif
